intro: Gouania striata var. puberula, commonly known as the pubescent gouania, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, pubescent stems and leaves, which give it its specific variety name. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
